intro: Stereoxylon pendulum, commonly known as the hanging wood plant, is a unique member of the Podostemaceae family. It is a semi-aquatic plant that thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments, typically along the edges of rivers and streams. Its distinctive feature is its elongated, pendulous stems that hang over the water, supporting small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny, clustered flowers that are often submerged or partially submerged, adapting to its aquatic habitat. Stereoxylon pendulum plays a role in stabilizing riverbanks and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
